intro: Thlaspi hesperium, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, clustered flowers that range from white to pale yellow. The plant typically has basal leaves that are pinnately divided, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Thlaspi hesperium is native to rocky and alpine environments in Europe and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
